subject: Personal Finance
title: Negative Interest Rates
description: A short lesson to help you apply Negative Interest Rates.

hook.text: In 2014, the European Central Bank charged banks to hold money. You lost money by saving.

buildup.text: Negative rates mean the lender pays the borrower. It sounds impossible, but it happened.

discovery.text: Central banks use negative rates to force banks to lend money instead of hoarding it.

twist.text: Japan, Switzerland, and the Eurozone all tried it. The results were mixed at best.

climax.text: Negative rates show how far central banks will go to stimulate a stagnant economy.

punchline.text: Sometimes you get paid to borrow.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of negative interest rates?
options: To encourage banks to lend instead of hoarding cash
